content:
• Thursday, August 18, 2011
  • CRM

    Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) is up 3.5% AH after delivering Q2 results that beat Street forecasts. The...

    Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) is up 3.5% AH after delivering Q2 results that beat Street forecasts. The company's closely-watched deferred revenue balance rose 37% Y/Y to $935M. Sales to the Americas rose 8% Q/Q. Salesforce expects FY12 revenue of $2.22B-$2.23B, above a prior forecast of $2.15B-$2.17B. EPS guidance of $1.30-$1.32 is unchanged. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 PM | 5 Comments
  • MENT

    More on Mentor Graphics (NASDAQ:MENT): Q2 beats estimates, boosted by a tax adjustment and...

    More on Mentor Graphics (NASDAQ:MENT): Q2 beats estimates, boosted by a tax adjustment and strong sales from its system and software businesses. The company reafirms guidance for FY11, but boosts its Q3 forecast, now expecting an EPS of $0.21 on revenues of about $245M versus expectations for $0.19 on revenues of $238.55M. Shares +4.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM
  • ADSK

    More on Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK): Q2 earnings easily beat on a 16% Y/Y gain in revenues. Cash flow...

    More on Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK): Q2 earnings easily beat on a 16% Y/Y gain in revenues. Cash flow from operations jumped 17% Y/Y, as the company "experienced strong demand across all geographies and business segments" said CEO Carl Bass. Shares +4.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM
  • SGI

    Silicon Graphics (NASDAQ:SGI): Reports a record FQ4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.15. Revenues of...

    Silicon Graphics (NASDAQ:SGI): Reports a record FQ4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.15. Revenues of $190M (+55% Y/Y) beats by $29M. Raises its FY12 guidance, now seeing revenue at $740M to $780M and EPS between $0.60 and $0.80, vs. expectations of $722M in revenue and EPS of $0.83. Shares +12.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK) cuts Q2 guidance due to a significant drop in wafer prices, now expecting...

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK) cuts Q2 guidance due to a significant drop in wafer prices, now expecting revenue to be in the range of $480 to $500M, far below analysts' expectations of $714M. The company also expects to write-down $55M to $60M of inventories, and lowers FY11 estimates. Shares plunge -20% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • ARO

    More on Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q2 EPS and revenues miss estimates on a 93% plunge in profits as...

    More on Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q2 EPS and revenues miss estimates on a 93% plunge in profits as markdowns and discounts decimate its gross margins. Same store sales dropped sharply as high-end competitors cut prices. The company lowers guidance for FY11, now expecting Q3 EPS to be between $0.02 to $0.03. Shares -8.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • MRVL

    More on Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q2 results beat expectations on solid revenue growth...

    More on Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q2 results beat expectations on solid revenue growth in all segments, boosted by an 18% jump in sales from its mobile and wireless unit. The company reafirms guidance in the mid-range of estimates for FY11. Shares +13% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • INTU

    More on Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU): FQ4 beat as strong sales of QuickBooks and Turbo Tax gave a boost...

    More on Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU): FQ4 beat as strong sales of QuickBooks and Turbo Tax gave a boost to its small business segment. The company guides FY12 higher, now expecting non-GAAP EPS of $2.85 to $2.94 on revenue of $4.185B to $4.285B, compared to expectations of $2.84 on $4.1B. Shares +0.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • IBM

    Human resource software provider Kenexa (KNXA -15.9%) tanked today, as anything connected with...

    Human resource software provider Kenexa (KNXA -15.9%) tanked today, as anything connected with employment was hit hard by this mornings weak jobs number.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • NTAP

    A few more victims of NetApp's (NTAP -14%) implosion today: Velti PLC (VELT -14.6%), Citrix...

    A few more victims of NetApp's (NTAP -14%) implosion today: Velti PLC (VELT -14.6%), Citrix Systems (CTXS -11.5%), Cognizant Technology (CTSH -12.6%), Informatica (INFA -10%).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM): Q2 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $546M (+39% Y/Y) beats by...

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM): Q2 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $546M (+39% Y/Y) beats by $17M. Shares -0.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 7 Comments
  • HPQ

    More on H-P (NYSE:HPQ): We've all been talking about a PC-business spinoff and Autonomy buy all...

    More on H-P (NYSE:HPQ): We've all been talking about a PC-business spinoff and Autonomy buy all day, but confirmation of its tablet bailout (in the face of heavy competition from AAPL) comes just 15 months after the company spent more than $1B on Palm and its webOS. It lowered targets for the third time this year. The game plan looks more IBM than ever. An interesting conference call webcast coming at 5 p.m.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • INTU

    Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU): FQ4 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $593M (+10% Y/Y) beats by...

    Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU): FQ4 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $593M (+10% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • CSCO

    BroadSoft (BSFT -15.9%) finishes the day near its lows on heavier than average volume as a weak...

    BroadSoft (BSFT -15.9%) finishes the day near its lows on heavier than average volume as a weak tech tape and reports of insider selling hammer the shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    Pessimistic investors pick up large batches of option contracts in Bank of America (BAC -5.6%)...

    Pessimistic investors pick up large batches of option contracts in Bank of America (BAC -5.6%) that would profit if shares fall more than 40% over the next three months. The November $4 put contracts were BofA's most heavily trafficked options contracts, with more than 63,000 changing hands.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARX

    Aeroflex (ARX -18.9%) trades lower after its FQ4 came in pretty much in-line, but the company...

    Aeroflex (ARX -18.9%) trades lower after its FQ4 came in pretty much in-line, but the company lowers FY12 guidance due to reductions in government spending and a pullback in customer orders over concerns of an economic slowdown.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • ARUN

    Shares of Aruba Networks (ARUN -18.1%) are down after Pacific Crest downgraded the stock, citing...

    Shares of Aruba Networks (ARUN -18.1%) are down after Pacific Crest downgraded the stock, citing deteriorating fundamentals and a heightened downside risk to forward guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • GME

    Investors reconsider their initially negative take on GameStop's (GME +4.4%) Q2 results and...

    Investors reconsider their initially negative take on GameStop's (GME +4.4%) Q2 results and power shares higher amid the day's carnage. “People need to understand here that the areas of the highest margin are growing,” Sterne Agee's Arvind Bhatia said this morning, citing gains in used game sales and the digital business, and someone must've been listening.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • HMPR

    Hampton Roads Bankshares (HMPR +4.8%) holds on to gains after announcing earlier that it's...

    Hampton Roads Bankshares (HMPR +4.8%) holds on to gains after announcing earlier that it's President and CEO John A.B. Davies Jr. is resigning to return to his prior work as a banking consultant. General Counsel and COO Douglas Glenn will assume the position of interim President and CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • SEEL

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI +4.5%) holds on to gains late in the day, after receiving FDA approval...

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI +4.5%) holds on to gains late in the day, after receiving FDA approval for its anti-fungal OTC drug Tolnaftate-D, containing the company's NexACT technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • WMT

    Shares of Wal-Mart WMT nudge 0.3% higher, no small feat with today's market carnage. A Murray...

    Shares of Wal-Mart WMT nudge 0.3% higher, no small feat with today's market carnage. A Murray Leith analyst sees a bargain, pointing out same-store sales increased every month in Q2 and WMT "continues to expand internationally and there is ample opportunity for margin expansion."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • HPQ

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) now down 6% as it confirms the day's stories on exploring an Autonomy purchase...

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) now down 6% as it confirms the day's stories on exploring an Autonomy purchase and a PC spinoff. The company will discontinue its webOS device operations, including phones and tablets. It estimates full-year revenue of $127.2B-$127.6B, down from a previous $129B-$130B.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ -3.1%) gets a jump on earnings by cutting its forecast: preliminary Q3 GAAP EPS of...

    H-P (HPQ -3.1%) gets a jump on earnings by cutting its forecast: preliminary Q3 GAAP EPS of $0.93 (non-GAAP: $1.10) on revenue of $31.2B, and sees Q4 revenue of $32.1B-$32.5B. Shares are halted and will resume trading at 3:15 p.m. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • DPZ

    Shares of Domino's (DPZ -2.6%) perform better than other restaurant stocks after Oppenheimer...

    Shares of Domino's (DPZ -2.6%) perform better than other restaurant stocks after Oppenheimer singles out the firm with an upgrade to Outperform from Perform, but slices ratings on peers. Downgrades: Texas Roadhouse (TXRH -8.6%), Starbucks (SBUX -9.9%), Einstein (BAGL -6.8%), Sonic (SONC -7.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NTAP -15.7%) isn't without defenders on this bleak day. Gleacher thinks the Street...

    NetApp (NTAP -15.7%) isn't without defenders on this bleak day. Gleacher thinks the Street underestimates the resiliency of NetApp's business model, and RBC believes the company is well-positioned to keep gaining market share. However, FBN is cutting NetApp to Sector Perform, believing its FY12 analyst day targets need to come down. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • MTP

    Shares in DARA BioSciences (DARA +8.7%) get a boost today, after commenting earlier that its...

    Shares in DARA BioSciences (DARA +8.7%) get a boost today, after commenting earlier that its investigational drug KRN5500 has been granted a fast-track designation by the FDA to treat chemotherapy-induced neuropathic pain in cancer patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • DXLG

    Casual Male (CMRG) is one of the few bright spots in the market today, now up over +15% after...

    Casual Male (CMRG) is one of the few bright spots in the market today, now up over +15% after beating on its Q2 and reaffirming its FY11 forecast for the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • COL

    BE Aerospace (BEAV -10.6%) gets hit today after RBC Capital downgrades the stock to outperform...

    BE Aerospace (BEAV -10.6%) gets hit today after RBC Capital downgrades the stock to outperform and removes it from its from "Top Pick" list, citing a mix of high-beta volatility and looming economic uncertainty.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • URI

    Macquarie downgrades three construction equipment-rental companies this morning, citing a weak...

    Macquarie downgrades three construction equipment-rental companies this morning, citing a weak recovery in the non-residential construction industry. The firm notes the Architecture Billings Index continues to decline, suggesting a muted recovery in 2012: United Rentals (URI -14.3%), RSC Holdings (RRR-OLD -10%) and HE Equipment Services (HEES -12.6%) are all cut to neutral (I II III).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • SCG

    Scana (SCG +1.2%) is one of just two gainers on the S&P 500, the subject of rumors from...

    Scana (SCG +1.2%) is one of just two gainers on the S&P 500, the subject of rumors from "industry sources" that say the utility company may consider putting itself up for sale. Scana is one of a rare number of S&P stocks that boast a dividend yield of 5% or more.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • MWW

    Staffing companies are casualties of today's weak jobless number: Monster Worldwide (MWW -9%),...

    Staffing companies are casualties of today's weak jobless number: Monster Worldwide (MWW -9%), Kelly Services (KELYA -6.5%), Manpower Associates (MAN -8.1%), Insperity (NSP -6%), Robert Half (RHI -5%), Dice Holdings  (DHX -8.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • QSR

    AFC Enterprises (AFCE), operator of the Popeyes restaurant chain, is down 13.2% after reporting...

    AFC Enterprises (AFCE), operator of the Popeyes restaurant chain, is down 13.2% after reporting revenue of $35.3M (+3% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.23; the latter was in-line with consensus, but the former missed by $1.1M. Same-store sales rose 0.7%. The company reiterates FY11 EPS guidance of $0.91-$0.95, but is lowering its same-store sales guidance range.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • FENG

    Chinese content service provider Phoenix New Media (FENG -13.9%) is getting hit today after...

    Chinese content service provider Phoenix New Media (FENG -13.9%) is getting hit today after reporting Q2 earnings that largely beat estimates, but operating costs doubled on soaring marketing and compensation expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • GT

    Goodyear Tire (GT -10.8%) takes a bigger hit than most today after Goldman cut it to sell,...

    Goodyear Tire (GT -10.8%) takes a bigger hit than most today after Goldman cut it to sell, saying it sees a raw materials-led deceleration in earnings in H2.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • HPQ

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +1.5%) drops back, maybe as realization sets in among the cynics that the...

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +1.5%) drops back, maybe as realization sets in among the cynics that the leak was a purposeful one - done to get some good news on the wires before what may be a weak earnings report after the close.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • HPQ

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +6%) is rocketing (and taking the DJIA with it) on a Bloomberg report it is...

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +6%) is rocketing (and taking the DJIA with it) on a Bloomberg report it is to spin off its personal computer business. Additionally, it is reported the firm will make a $10B bid for software company Autonomy.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +5.4%) pops despite a 61% drop in Q2 earnings on higher development and advertising...

    Sina (SINA +5.4%) pops despite a 61% drop in Q2 earnings on higher development and advertising costs. Adjusted profit was better-than-expected, as core ad business improved and Weibo logs over 200M registered users, up more than 40% since April.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • KODK

    Not everything is in the toilet today, as Eastman Kodak (EK +18.2%) rallies after yesterday's...

    Not everything is in the toilet today, as Eastman Kodak (EK +18.2%) rallies after yesterday's late news that the company had begun exploring a sale of its digital imaging patents. Shares pick up where they left off after spiking 25% in yesterday's session on speculation over the move.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • EJ

    Chinese real estate servicer E-House (EJ +2.8%) records a slight miss on its Q2 EPS, but beats...

    Chinese real estate servicer E-House (EJ +2.8%) records a slight miss on its Q2 EPS, but beats on revenues, with a 57% jump in Y/Y profit despite a slowdown in the Chinese real estate market. Online sales soared 116% through channel market growth and its expanded agreement with Baidu (BIDU -5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • DE

    UBS reiterates its Buy rating on shares of Deere (DE -5.3%) and lowers it price target to $110,...

    UBS reiterates its Buy rating on shares of Deere (DE -5.3%) and lowers it price target to $110, from $115. In yesterday's CC the firm said fundamentals in the U.S. and Canada farm sectors are strong, and it kept its growth forecast in a 5%-10% range.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • SOA

    Shares of Solutia (SOA sink 9% after the firm's ability to reach its sales target looks shakier...

    Shares of Solutia (SOA sink 9% after the firm's ability to reach its sales target looks shakier and takeover whispers subside. Jefferies trims its 2012 EPS estimate a nickel to $2.55.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • DXLG

    Specialty clothing retailer Casual Male (CMRG +3.2%) gains after reporting Q2 revenue of $100.9M...

    Specialty clothing retailer Casual Male (CMRG +3.2%) gains after reporting Q2 revenue of $100.9M (+4% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.14, beating consensus by $1.4M and $0.01. Same-store sales rose 4.9%. The company expects FY11 revenue of $405M-$410M, in-line with a $407.1M consensus, and free cash flow of $17.5M-$20M. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • SMRT

    Retail merchandiser Stein Mart (SMRT -8%) takes a hit after its Q2 earnings plunged on weak...

    Retail merchandiser Stein Mart (SMRT -8%) takes a hit after its Q2 earnings plunged on weak sales and forced markdowns due to excess inventory. Same store sales declined 1.1%, while total sales were off 2.1%, as a consumers reign in spending over concerns about the economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • CIS

    Shares of Camelot Information Systems (CIS -36%) plummet after missing Q2 estimates due to asset...

    Shares of Camelot Information Systems (CIS -36%) plummet after missing Q2 estimates due to asset write-offs and contract delays. The company lowers Q3 guidance, now expecting Q3 revenues of $63M and earnings per ADS of $0.20, versus expectations for revenues of $67.9M and earnings per ADS of $0.22.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • GENTY

    Gentium S.p.A. (GENT -28%) gets clobbered after voluntarily withdrawing its new drug application...

    Gentium S.p.A. (GENT -28%) gets clobbered after voluntarily withdrawing its new drug application for Defibrotide following a recent notification from the FDA identifying numerous problems with the company's submission.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • BCS

    Update on European bank shares. U.K.: BCS -11%, RBS -11%, LYG -9%, HBC -6%. France: SocGen...

    Update on European bank shares. U.K.: BCS -11%, RBS -11%, LYG -9%, HBC -6%. France: SocGen OTCPK:SCGLY -13%. Italy: Unicredit -7% (suspended). Germany: DB -6%. Switzerland: UBS -8%. Euro financial ETF: EUFN -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • NTAP

    High-beta cloud, virtualization, and "big data" infrastructure stocks are some of the biggest...

    High-beta cloud, virtualization, and "big data" infrastructure stocks are some of the biggest losers today. NetApp's (NTAP -19.5%) results are likely playing a role, as is the general sell-off of any asset deemed to be risky. VMW -11.5%. RVBD -16.9%. CTXS -9.8%. APKT -17.2%. N -8.7%. INFA -13.7%. TIBX -13%. FFIV -9.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • CPF

    More on regional bank shares: Regional ETF: RKH -4.4%, Central Pacific  CPF -8.6%, First...

    More on regional bank shares: Regional ETF: RKH -4.4%, Central Pacific  CPF -8.6%, First Horizon FHN -6.3%, Zions ZION -6%, Bank of the Ozarks OZRK -4.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • BAC

    Following Europe, financial stocks (XLF -5.1%) are in dismal shape, as shares of everything from...

    Following Europe, financial stocks (XLF -5.1%) are in dismal shape, as shares of everything from big banks - BAC -7.6%, C -9.3%, JPM -4.9%, WFC -4.7% - to regionals (KRE -4.8%) slump; the regional index hits a 21-month low. European banks plunge: BCS -10.7%, RBS -11.4%, HBC -6.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • TECD

    IT products distributor Tech Data (TECD +0.6%) is outperforming after reporting FQ2 revenue of...

    IT products distributor Tech Data (TECD +0.6%) is outperforming after reporting FQ2 revenue of $6.45B (+18% Y/Y) and EPS of $1.10, beating consensus by $320M and $0.14. The company is authorizing a new $100M share repurchase program. It expects "mid-single digit organic sales growth" in both the U.S. and Europe in FQ2.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • TLT

    The 10 year Treasury takes out 2%, now yielding 1.98%. TLT +3.2%.

    The 10 year Treasury takes out 2%, now yielding 1.98%. TLT +3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 3 Comments

  • The market's fear gauge, the CBOE Volatility Index, spikes 25% and is closing in on a reading of...

    The market's fear gauge, the CBOE Volatility Index, spikes 25% and is closing in on a reading of 40. The VIX hasn't traded below 30 since S&P downgraded U.S. debt, but sat at a placid level of 14 only two months ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 1 Comment

  • Declines in Europe are accelerating. Stoxx 50 -6.6%, Germany -6.9%, Italy -6.8%, U.K. -5.5%....

    Declines in Europe are accelerating. Stoxx 50 -6.6%, Germany -6.9%, Italy -6.8%, U.K. -5.5%. Euro -0.8% at $1.43.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -5.1%) reports global retail sales of construction machinery increased 35%...

    Caterpillar (CAT -5.1%) reports global retail sales of construction machinery increased 35% (M/M) in July, paced by 52% growth in Latin America. By sector, industrial engines were the leader with 37% growth, while marine engines were the laggard at down 1%. Shares of CAT trail all other Dow components for the day except BAC and HPQ.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • TWX

    Shares in TV companies follow Time Warner (TWX -4%) lower, possibly on CEO Jeff Bewkes' comments...

    Shares in TV companies follow Time Warner (TWX -4%) lower, possibly on CEO Jeff Bewkes' comments about weaker ad sales. DIS -2.6%, CMCSA -2.1%, VIA -2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • SSI

    Stage Stores (NYSE:SSI) falls 10.8% after reporting a revenue miss for Q2 and saying it expects...

    Stage Stores (NYSE:SSI) falls 10.8% after reporting a revenue miss for Q2 and saying it expects same-store sales to grow at 1%-3% for the rest of the year. The firm sees Q3 sales of $340M-$346M, Q4 sales of $468M-$477M and FY11 sales at $1.51M-$1.52M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • NTAP

    Storage stocks join NetApp (NTAP -15.4%) in underperforming the NASDAQ after its weak FQ1...

    Storage stocks join NetApp (NTAP -15.4%) in underperforming the NASDAQ after its weak FQ1 report. EMC -8.6%. BRCD -4.3%. QLGC -3.7%. ELX -7.2%. CVLT -6.7%. STX -5.6%. WDC -6.6%. BRCD reports after the bell today. (more on NTAP)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • JASO

    JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) drops 14.3% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue of $413M (+12% Y/Y) and...

    JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) drops 14.3% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue of $413M (+12% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.22, missing consensus by $5.6M and $0.19. Gross margin fell to -2.7%. The company is lowering its 2011 shipment forecast to 1.8GW from a prior 2.2GW. Like other solar names, JA Solar blames European weakness for its poor results.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 2 Comments
  • BAC

    In conjunction with their European counterparts, American banking shares are sharply lower...

    In conjunction with their European counterparts, American banking shares are sharply lower premarket. XLF -3.2%,  BAC -5.1%, C -4.8%, WFC -3.1%, JPM -3.3%, Regions Financial RF -4.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • QIHU

    Chinese web browser and security software provider Qihoo 360 (NYSE:QIHU) is up 5.4% premarket...

    Chinese web browser and security software provider Qihoo 360 (NYSE:QIHU) is up 5.4% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue of $35.1M (+177% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.11, beating consensus by $6M and $0.05. The company's penetration rate of Chinese Internet users rose to 92%. It expects Q3 revenue of $41M-$42M, well above a $32M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • GLNG

    Golar LNG (NASDAQ:GLNG) falls 4.7% premarket after reporting a Q2 loss of $0.6M on revenue of...

    Golar LNG (NASDAQ:GLNG) falls 4.7% premarket after reporting a Q2 loss of $0.6M on revenue of $74M (+33% Y/Y). Vessel utilization increased to 97%, from 91% the previous quarter, adding to the top-line result. The firm sees the market for tankers designed to carry natural gas for long hauls as "structurally tight."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • CNX

    Premarket gainers: CNX +10%.Losers: GENT -20%. NTAP -14%. JASO -12%. MGM -11%. PLCE -7%. BCS...

    Premarket gainers: CNX +10%.
    Losers: GENT -20%. NTAP -14%. JASO -12%. MGM -11%. PLCE -7%. BCS -8%. CBOU -7%. LYG -7%. IVR -7%. EMC -6%. SD -6%. MPEL -5%. UBS -5%. ALU -5%. TTM -5%. CS -5%. ING -5%. IRE -5%. AVB -5%. JDSU -5%. DRYS -5%. DNDN -5%. BAC -5%. HBC -5%. YOKU -5%. PHG -4%. MT -4%. C -4%. SDRL -4%. BIDU -4%. NFLX -4%. MU -4%. DB -4%. RENN -4%. LVS -4%. BHP -4%. LVLT -4%. TS -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
